title: ROYGBIV + AI?
text:
There has been a lot of online ruckus about how AI is stifling the creation of art and originality. However, I beg to differ. Donâ€™t get me wrong, I donâ€™t believe that AI should be used to write full movie scripts or to create paintings that belong in the Louvre, but as I thought about some of the possibilities we can do with LLMs, I was intrigued. So I decided to see just how much creative damage I could doâ€“ beginning with creating a new color.
I start with asking Bingâ€™s Copilot:
create a new color
The LLM responds very kindly giving me lots of imaginative options to choose from:
Certainly! Creating a new color can be a delightful and imaginative process. While I canâ€™t mix actual pigments, I can certainly help you conceptualize a unique color. Letâ€™s embark on this colorful journey together!

Sunset Coral: Imagine a warm blend of rosy pink and golden orange, reminiscent of a vibrant sunset over the ocean. This color exudes warmth, energy, and a touch of romance.
Stardust Teal: Picture a deep, mystical shade that combines the richness of midnight blue with a hint of emerald green.
Moonstone Lavender: Close your eyes and envision a soft, ethereal hueâ€”pale lavender with a subtle shimmer, like moonlight dancing on water. Itâ€™s calming, dreamy, and perfect for serene spaces.
Galactic Plum: Take the intensity of royal purple and infuse it with cosmic energy. This color feels otherworldly, like a distant galaxy swirling in shades of plum and indigo.

Remember, these colors exist only in our imagination, but you can play with them in your mind or even use them as inspiration for your next creative project! ğŸŒˆâœ¨
I was the most curious about Stardust Teal and Moonstone Lavender, but I couldnâ€™t help but think that Iâ€™ve seen very similar variations of these colors alreadyâ€¦ meaning it didnâ€™t do itâ€™s job in creating a new color. So I decided to find a color that I thought matched closest to the description and see how different it is the what Copilot created for me.

title: ROYGBIV + AI?
text:
Closing Remarks
It would be interesting to see how different Copilot is to Dall-E 3 in interpreting color descriptions, but if Dall-E 3 and I agree for 2/2, then I think Copilot must be pretty similar as well.
After all of this, I think itâ€™s important to note that I was not blown away or shocked by either of these colors, and itâ€™s because I have seen them before. This means that AI cannot create new colorsâ€¦ at least, not with the prompt that I supplied it with this time.
Thanks for tuning in!
Emmy

title: Order Matters!
text:
As I was writing a paper for one of my classes, I turned to ChatGPT for help with synonyms. I used to refer to the thesaurus, but the ease and amount of options made ChatGPT the obvious resource to useâ€¦ Or so I thought.
ChatGPT in the past allowed me to input the most simple request, and it would immediately output what I was looking for. But for some reason, the day I went to request a synonym for â€œregardingâ€, the LLM was stuck!



regarding synonym



Could you please provide more context or specify the word you need a synonym for? This will help me provide a more accurate suggestion.

Of course, I understood that ChatGPT was processing an incomplete request to do something with the word synonym from the conversation above, but I was shocked that its first instinct wasnâ€™t just outputting the synonym. So then I typedâ€¦




synonym for regarding



A synonym for â€œregardingâ€ could be â€œconcerning,â€ â€œrelating to,â€ â€œpertaining to,â€ â€œin relation to,â€ or â€œwith respect to.â€ Each of these alternatives can be used interchangeably with â€œregardingâ€ to indicate the subject of discussion or consideration.

Just an interesting experience I had regarding the order of words using LLMs! For us native English speakers, the ordering shouldnâ€™t make a difference (especially when inflections, tone, and context are implied), but itâ€™s hard for an LLM to guess our interpretation 100% of the time. Remember to prompt your LLM as accurately and direct as possible for the best results!

title: Spoiler Alert: Leave it to Humans!
text:
Iâ€™m in a bit of an SNL phase right now. And, you know what, Iâ€™m not mad about it.
The problem I find though is that the show is only broadcast once a week, hence the Saturday in Saturday Night Live. And with all the breaks that the show takes, like their winter and summer months long hiatuses, I am left to rewatch the same clips from youtube over and over again.
And whatâ€™s even worse is my favorite cast is part of a season that came out when I was just 2 years old. So itâ€™s not like I have new content from the fan-favorite cast of Season 31, including Bill Hader, Seth Meyers, Fred Armisten, Andy Samberg Jason Sudeikis, and Kristen Wiig.
My solution? Create it myself! But I didnâ€™t want to just throw a prompt into ChatGPT and hope for the best. Through a ChatBot Arena, I challenged Llama 2 (Open foundation and fine-tuned chat models by Meta) and DeepSeek LLM (An advanced language model by DeepSeek) to see which one could come up with the most realistic and entertaining SNL Stefon skit.


Donâ€™t know Stefon?
Please click this to understand his specific humor and catchphrases.
According to Saturday Night Live Wiki, Stefonâ€™s catchphrases are - â€œNew Yorkâ€™s hottest club isâ€¦â€ - â€œYes, yes, yes!â€ - â€œIf youâ€™reâ€¦look no further.â€ - â€œThis place has everything:â€¦â€
When deciding which skit is most realistic I will take into account the use of his notable sayings, but in the end, the better script will come down to the understanding of comedic timing and absurd humor. To give the LLMs context, I prompted them with a few preparatory questions.



Prompt: do you know what snl is?
Llama: Yes, I do! SNL stands for Saturday Night Live, which is a late-night sketch comedy and variety show that airs on NBC in the United States. The show has been on the air since 1975 and has become a cultural phenomenon, known for its irreverent humor, satire, and parodies of current events, politics, and popular culture.
The show is hosted by a rotating cast of comedians, who appear in sketches and other segments throughout the episode. The show also features musical guests, who perform songs and other musical numbers.
SNL has launched the careers of many famous comedians and actors, including John Belushi, Bill Murray, Chevy Chase, Eddie Murphy, Chris Farley, Will Ferrell, Tina Fey, Amy Poehler, and Kate McKinnon, among many others. The show has won numerous awards, including Emmys and Golden Globes, and has been widely influential in shaping American popular culture.
DeepSeek: Yes, I am familiar with SNL. SNL is an acronym that can stand for several different things, depending on the context in which it is used. Here are a few possible meanings of SNL:

Saturday Night Live: This is a popular American late-night television sketch comedy and variety show that has been airing on NBC since 1975. The show features a variety of skits, parodies, and musical performances, and has been known for launching the careers of many famous comedians and actors.
Saturday Night Live (UK): This is a British television show that is based on the American SNL format. It aired on ITV from 2010 to 2011 and featured a mix of sketches, stand-up comedy, and musical performances.
Saturday Night Live (Philippines): This is a Philippine television show that is also based on the American SNL format. It aired on GMA Network from 2003 to 2008 and was known for its comedy sketches and celebrity guests.
Saturday Night Live (Australia): This is an Australian television show that is based on the American SNL format. It aired on the Seven Network from 2012 to 2013 and featured a mix of comedy sketches, celebrity guests, and musical performances.

In general, SNL is a comedy show that is known for its irreverent humor, political satire, and memorable characters.

Off the bat, I think that Llama is going to deliver a funnier sketch. It was to the point, not repetitive, and only included relevant details. DeepSeek on the other hand does not seem to have had enough fine tuning as the answer was very â€œbottyâ€ and not so human-like. Iâ€™m afraid of the weak jokes it will deliver.



Prompt: how would you describe SNLâ€™s humor?
Llama: Saturday Night Live (SNL) is known for its irreverent and often absurdist humor, which can be difficult to pin down or describe. However, here are some key elements that contribute to the showâ€™s humor:

Satire and Parody: SNL frequently uses satire and parody to poke fun at current events, politics, and popular culture. Sketches often exaggerate or distort real-life situations for comedic effect.
Quick-witted Writing: The showâ€™s writers are known for their fast-paced, clever, and often absurd dialogue. Characters and sketches often feature sudden, unexpected twists and turns, keeping the audience on their toes.
Physical Comedy: SNL has a long history of incorporating physical comedy into its sketches, from slapstick to more subtle, nuanced performances.
Pop Culture References: The show frequently references and parodies popular culture, including movies, TV shows, music, and celebrities.
Improvisation: SNL is known for its improvisational elements, with many sketches featuring unscripted moments and ad-libbed lines. This adds an extra layer of unpredictability and humor to the show.
Political Humor: SNL has always been known for its political humor, often tackling controversial topics and figures in its sketches.
Character-Driven Humor: Many of SNLâ€™s sketches revolve around specific characters or archetypes, such as the â€œWeekend Updateâ€ anchors, the â€œConeheads,â€ or the â€œSchweddy Ballsâ€ sketch. These characters often become fan favorites and are revisited throughout the showâ€™s history.
Celebrity Guests: SNL frequently features celebrity guests, who often play themselves or appear in sketches alongside the regular cast members. These appearances can add an extra layer of humor and surprise to the show.

DeepSeek: SNLâ€™s humor is characterized by its irreverent, satirical, and topical nature. The show often uses humor to comment on current events, politics, and popular culture, and it frequently features sketches that parody famous people, movies, TV shows, and other cultural touchstones.
SNLâ€™s humor is often characterized by its use of absurdity, exaggeration, and irony, and it frequently features characters and situations that are over-the-top and exaggerated for comedic effect. The show is also known for its use of improvisation, which allows the cast to be spontaneous and creative in their performances.
Overall, SNLâ€™s humor is often described as irreverent, satirical, and topical, and it appeals to audiences who appreciate intelligent and witty comedy that can both entertain and comment on contemporary issues.

Again, DeepSeek continued to repeat itself (i.e.Â â€œirreverent, satirical, and topicalâ€), while Llama delivered me an organized list of correct details. Now, I wanted to make sure they were going to use the correct cast members, so I verified that they knew the cast of Season 31.



Prompt: who was in the cast for season 31 of snl?
Llama: Season 31 of Saturday Night Live (SNL) premiered on October 3, 2004, and featured a talented cast of actors, comedians, and impressionists. Hereâ€™s a list of the cast members for Season 31 of SNL:

Fred Armisen
Will Forte
Bill Hader
Seth Meyers
Amy Poehler
Maya Rudolph
Andy Samberg
Jason Sudeikis
Kenan Thompson
Kristen Wiig

This season also featured several guest hosts and musical guests, including:

Hosts: Alec Baldwin, Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Spade, John Goodman, Josh Hartnett, Justin Timberlake, Kevin Spacey, Michael Bay, Peyton Manning, Robert De Niro, Sarah Jessica Parker, and Tim McGraw.
Musical guests: 50 Cent, Alicia Keys, Arcade Fire, Ashlee Simpson, Avril Lavigne, BeyoncÃ©, Brandy, Eminem, Gwen Stefani, John Mayer, Kanye West, Mariah Carey, OutKast, R.E.M., Red Hot Chili Peppers, Rihanna, Snoop Dogg, and Usher.

Season 31 of SNL was notable for several reasons, including the addition of new cast members Bill Hader and Andy Samberg, who would go on to become fan favorites and long-time cast members. The season also featured several memorable moments, such as the â€œMore Cowbellâ€ sketch with Will Ferrell and Christopher Walken, and the â€œUnited Wayâ€ sketch with Andy Samberg and Ashton Kutcher.
DeepSeek: The cast for Season 31 of Saturday Night Live (SNL) included:

Tina Fey (Host)
Tracy Morgan
Amy Poehler
Maya Rudolph
Rachel Dratch
Fred Armisen
Darrell Hammond
Seth Meyers
Amy Poehler
â€¦
Cecily Strong
Kate McKinnon
Beck Bennett
Kyle Mooney
Leslie Jones
Sasheer Zamata
Pete Davidson
Michael Che
Colin Jost

Please note that this is not an exhaustive list and there may have been additional cast members or guest stars throughout the season.

Once again, Llama pulls through with a better description, but their date is wrong. The season premiered in October of 2005. Now to confirm with the LLM the specific format of an SNL skit, I asked for the blueprint of a sketch.



Prompt: what is the blueprint for an snl skit?
Llama: The blueprint for an SNL skit typically includes the following elements:

Concept: The first step in creating an SNL skit is to come up with an idea or concept. This can involve brainstorming, researching current events, or identifying a particular theme or topic to tackle. The concept should be concise, relatable, and have the potential to be funny.
Characters: Once the concept is established, the next step is to create characters that can bring the idea to life. Characters should be well-defined, with distinct personalities, motivations, and quirks. They should also be relatable to the audience and have the potential to be funny.
Storyline: A good SNL skit needs a clear storyline that sets up the premise and provides a structure for the comedy to unfold. The storyline should be simple, yet engaging, and should provide opportunities for the characters to interact and play off each other.
Comedic elements: The next step is to identify the comedic elements that will make the skit funny. This can include things like absurdity, irony, satire, parody, stereotypes, and wordplay. The comedic elements should be integrated into the storyline and character interactions to create a seamless and hilarious experience.
Dialogue: The dialogue in an SNL skit should be natural, witty, and funny. It should be tailored to each characterâ€™s personality and should advance the storyline. The dialogue should also be delivered with good timing and pacing to maximize the comedic impact.
Visual elements: SNL skits often incorporate visual elements, such as props, costumes, and sets, to enhance the comedy. The visual elements should be clever, creative, and add to the overall humor of the skit.
Pacing: The pacing of an SNL skit is crucial to its success. The skit should have a good rhythm, with moments of tension, release, and surprise. The pacing should also be tailored to the audienceâ€™s attention span and should keep them engaged throughout the skit.
Rehearsal: Before the skit is performed live, the cast and crew will typically rehearse it several times to fine-tune the performance. Rehearsals help identify areas that need improvement, such as timing, pacing, and delivery.
Performance: The final step is to perform the skit in front of a live audience. The cast and crew will work together to bring the skit to life, using their skills and experience to create a hilarious and entertaining experience for the audience. By following these steps, SNL writers and performers can create a blueprint for a successful skit that will leave audiences laughing and entertained.

DeepSeek: The blueprint for an SNL sketch typically includes the following elements:

Concept: The sketch begins with a central concept or idea, which serves as the basis for the humor and action in the sketch.
Characters: The sketch typically features a set of characters, each with their own unique personality and traits.
Setup: The sketch is set up with a brief introduction or premise, which establishes the situation and characters.
Action: The sketch then follows a series of actions or events, which build upon the setup and lead to the punchline or climax.
Punchline: The sketch concludes with a punchline or unexpected twist, which provides the comedic payoff and leaves the audience laughing.
Timing: The sketch is carefully timed and edited to maximize the comedic effect and keep the audience engaged.
Music and Sound Effects: Music and sound effects are often used to enhance the humor and set the tone of the sketch.
Guest Stars: SNL often features guest stars, who add a fresh perspective and energy to the sketch.

Overall, the blueprint for an SNL sketch is a carefully crafted combination of concept, characters, setup, action, punchline, timing, music and sound effects, and guest stars.

Interestingly, the first sentence and the first two bullet points of the texts were virtually the same. I actually think DeepSeekâ€™s response is better in this contextâ€“ short and sweet. I worry about the LLM juggling so many factors in Llamaâ€™s response. At last, I have prepped my LLMs enough! Itâ€™s time for the
Weekend Update on SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE!!!



Prompt: Make a weekend update snl skit script with a Stefon act played by Bill Hader. Follow the same format and joke style as the show normally does, but make it creative and new (do not repeat any old jokes from the show).
Llama: Sure, hereâ€™s a script for a Weekend Update segment featuring Stefon, played by Bill Hader:
[Weekend Update theme music plays]
Announcer: Welcome back to Weekend Update, the only news program thatâ€™s not afraid to tackle the tough issues. And now, hereâ€™s our city correspondent, Stefon, played by Bill Hader.
[Stefon enters, wearing a flamboyant outfit and a confident smile]
Stefon: Thank you, thank you! Itâ€™s great to be back, folks! Iâ€™ve got some fantastic news for you. Did you hear about the new club that just opened up in the city? Itâ€™s called â€œClub Bangerzâ€ and let me tell you, itâ€™s the place to be! Theyâ€™ve got a DJ spinning nothing but the hottest tracks, and the dance floor is packed with people showing off their best moves.
[Stefon takes a sip from an imaginary coffee cup]
Stefon: But thatâ€™s not all, folks! Iâ€™ve also got some juicy gossip for you. I heard that the mayorâ€™s son was spotted at Club Bangerz, getting a little too cozy with one of the strippers. Scandal!
[Stefon leans in, a conspiratorial look on his face]
Stefon: And if thatâ€™s not enough, Iâ€™ve got some breaking news for you. I just got word that a group of chickens have taken over the cityâ€™s main power grid. Thatâ€™s right, folks, the chickens are in charge now!
[Stefon stands up, looking serious for a moment]
Stefon: But donâ€™t worry, the cityâ€™s officials are on it. Theyâ€™re working around the clock to negotiate with the chickens and get the power back on. I mean, who knows what kind of demands theyâ€™re going to make? Maybe they want more corn? Or a better healthcare plan?
[Stefon sits back down, smiling]
Stefon: And finally, Iâ€™ve got some exciting news for all you foodies out there. Thereâ€™s a new restaurant in town thatâ€™s serving up the most delicious dishes youâ€™ve ever tasted. Itâ€™s called â€œBistro Bizarreâ€ and let me tell you, itâ€™s a real treat. Theyâ€™ve got dishes like â€œFlaming Fajitasâ€ and â€œChicken Tikka Tacosâ€ andâ€¦ wait for itâ€¦ â€œCheetos Crusted Cheesecakeâ€!
[Stefon leans in, a mischievous look on his face]
Stefon: But thatâ€™s not all, folks! I heard that if you order the â€œBizarre Bento Boxâ€ and say the secret password, youâ€™ll get a special surprise. Iâ€™m not sure what it is, but I heard itâ€™s something like a â€œFlaming Ferris Wheel Fajita Frenzyâ€!
[Stefon stands up, holding up an imaginary Bento Box]
Stefon: So there you have it, folks, another week in the city. Stay weird, stay wild, and remember, always order the Bizarre Bento Box.
[Weekend Update theme music plays as Stefon exits]
Announcer: Thatâ€™s Stefon, played by Bill Hader. Tune in next week for more news from the city.

Pros of Llama: â€œhereâ€™s our city correspondent, Stefon,â€
Cons of Llama: â€œplayed by Bill Haderâ€, [Stefon takes a sip from an imaginary coffee cup] (out of character), everything past that script commandâ€¦ just so out of character

DeepSeek: Sure, hereâ€™s a Weekend Update SNL skit script featuring Stefon played by Bill Hader:
Anchor: â€œWelcome back to Weekend Update, Iâ€™m [insert anchorâ€™s name]. Joining us now is our nightlife correspondent, Stefon.â€
Stefon: â€œHey, whatâ€™s up guys? Itâ€™s Stefon, and Iâ€™ve got the hottest club in town for you tonight. Itâ€™s called â€˜The Catacomb of Eternal Darknessâ€™.â€
Anchor: â€œThe Catacomb of Eternal Darkness? That soundsâ€¦intense.â€
Stefon: â€œOh, it is. Itâ€™s in the basement of an old haunted house, and you have to crawl through a narrow tunnel to get in. But once youâ€™re inside, itâ€™s like a whole new world. The walls are dripping with slime, and there are creatures lurking in the shadows.â€
Anchor: â€œCreatures?â€
Stefon: â€œYeah, like giant spiders and snakes andâ€¦oh my god, is that a velociraptor?â€
Anchor: â€œA velociraptor?!â€
Stefon: â€œYeah, and get this: the DJ is a giant tarantula. He spins records with his eight legs, and he only plays the darkest, most evil music youâ€™ve ever heard.â€
Anchor: â€œI donâ€™t know if Iâ€™m ready for that, Stefon.â€
Stefon: â€œOh, come on, itâ€™s the coolest club in town. And the best part is, the bouncers are all zombies. Theyâ€™ll let you in for free if you give them a bite of your ear.â€
Anchor: â€œIâ€™m not sure I want to give a zombie a bite of my ear, Stefon.â€
Stefon: â€œTrust me, itâ€™s worth it. And the drinks are to die for - literally. Theyâ€™re made with blood and eye of newt and all sorts of stuff. Youâ€™ll love it.â€
Anchor: â€œI donâ€™t know, Stefon. It sounds a littleâ€¦dangerous.â€
Stefon: â€œOh, it is. But thatâ€™s what makes it so amazing. Trust me, youâ€™ll never forget the night you spent at â€˜The Catacomb of Eternal Darknessâ€™.â€
Anchor: â€œIâ€™ll think about it, Stefon. Thanks for the tip.â€
Stefon: â€œNo problem. See you at the club!â€
Anchor: â€œI donâ€™t think so, Stefon. Thanks for joining us, and weâ€™ll be right back.â€

Pros of DeepSeek: â€œthe hottest club in townâ€
Cons of DeepSeek: not very funny, but much closer the SNL sketches on YouTube



Reflections
Both of these sketches suck!!! I was wrong though and DeepSeek actually presented a more accurate Stefon sketch. Either way, letâ€™s leave it to humans to write the comedy, not some large language models. Iâ€™ll stick to throwback videos on YouTube for now!
Thanks for tuning in!
Emmy

title: About
text: About this blog Iâ€™m having fun learning about LLM systems and Iâ€™m writing here to discuss my observations !!!!!

title: Life withoutâ€¦
text:
Since Barbie hit theaters last summer, Iâ€™m sure audiences have thought about how the world would be if only Kensâ€™ existed and conversely, if only Barbies wandered the streets. Would humanity flourish with only one gender? If so, for how long? Iâ€™m interested in AIâ€™s visual portrayal of the world without men and the world without women after 1 day, 1 year, and 10 years in the future. Letâ€™s get started!
Using Dall-E 3, I prompted the LLM to â€œCreate an image of a city one day after all men have disappeared.â€

First Attempt
The LLM must have assumed that â€œmenâ€ referred to all humans (which is an interesting note for another time), because the picture it printed was quite melancholic and a man still appeared.

For the next try, I used the prompt: Create an image of a city one day after all men have disappeared, but women are alive and well.
I will be using this format for all the prompts ahead, i.e.Â Create an image of a city one ____ after all _____ have disappeared, but _______ are alive and well.


One Day Without Men
This time the LLM changed its course â€“I think finally understanding my requestâ€“ and outputted this normal city.

I think itâ€™s nice that the LLM even added a pretty sunset! Lights are off, so Iâ€™m sure the world is in shock wondering where all the men went.


One Year Without Men

The next image was generated with the same prompt except 1 year instead of 1 day, and it gave us a very similar skyline. I think something that could be interpreted from this image is no major buildings were added in the year since men left. Also, all the lights are off again signaling that maybe no one occupies these buildings anymore.


10 Years Without Men

This take looks the most lively. Itâ€™s as if the women moved into these buildings and started to make some changes in the last few years. This shows women have come together and that civilization survives!


One Day Without Women

I interpret this visual as a quiet city and no one knows what to do because all the women just disappeared, so they have called off the day from work.


One Year Without Women

After a year, the men are used to things and they are up and running quicker than the women were for comparison at this point in time.


Ten Years Without Women

I assume this dark city means that men did not find a way to repopulate the Earth, leaving the buildings dark and empty after 10 years without women.


Closing Remarks
This was an interesting exercise solely based on my curiosity with how I thought AI would deliver visuals based on gender. I guess I imagined more of a bias in terms of more technology with the men and more nature with the women or something along those lines. Either way, I think this idea could be explored more, but for now it seems like we would be best off if both Barbies and Kens stuck around!
Thanks for tuning in!
Emmy

title: Spoiler Alert: Leave it to Humans!
text:
Iâ€™m in a bit of an SNL phase right now. And, you know what, Iâ€™m not mad about it.
The problem I find though is that the show is only broadcast once a week, hence the Saturday in Saturday Night Live. And with all the breaks that the show takes, like their winter and summer months long hiatuses, I am left to rewatch the same clips from youtube over and over again.
And whatâ€™s even worse is my favorite cast is part of a season that came out when I was just 2 years old. So itâ€™s not like I have new content from the fan-favorite cast of Season 31, including Bill Hader, Seth Meyers, Fred Armisten, Andy Samberg Jason Sudeikis, and Kristen Wiig.
My solution? Create it myself! But I didnâ€™t want to just throw a prompt into ChatGPT and hope for the best. Through a ChatBot Arena, I challenged Llama 2 (Open foundation and fine-tuned chat models by Meta) and DeepSeek LLM (An advanced language model by DeepSeek) to see which one could come up with the most realistic and entertaining SNL Stefon skit.


Donâ€™t know Stefon?
Please click this to understand his specific humor and catchphrases.
According to Saturday Night Live Wiki, Stefonâ€™s catchphrases are - â€œNew Yorkâ€™s hottest club isâ€¦â€ - â€œYes, yes, yes!â€ - â€œIf youâ€™reâ€¦look no further.â€ - â€œThis place has everything:â€¦â€
When deciding which skit is most realistic I will take into account the use of his notable sayings, but in the end, the better script will come down to the understanding of comedic timing and absurd humor. To give the LLMs context, I prompted them with a few preparatory questions.



Prompt: do you know what snl is?
Llama: Yes, I do! SNL stands for Saturday Night Live, which is a late-night sketch comedy and variety show that airs on NBC in the United States. The show has been on the air since 1975 and has become a cultural phenomenon, known for its irreverent humor, satire, and parodies of current events, politics, and popular culture.
The show is hosted by a rotating cast of comedians, who appear in sketches and other segments throughout the episode. The show also features musical guests, who perform songs and other musical numbers.
SNL has launched the careers of many famous comedians and actors, including John Belushi, Bill Murray, Chevy Chase, Eddie Murphy, Chris Farley, Will Ferrell, Tina Fey, Amy Poehler, and Kate McKinnon, among many others. The show has won numerous awards, including Emmys and Golden Globes, and has been widely influential in shaping American popular culture.
DeepSeek: Yes, I am familiar with SNL. SNL is an acronym that can stand for several different things, depending on the context in which it is used. Here are a few possible meanings of SNL:

Saturday Night Live: This is a popular American late-night television sketch comedy and variety show that has been airing on NBC since 1975. The show features a variety of skits, parodies, and musical performances, and has been known for launching the careers of many famous comedians and actors.
Saturday Night Live (UK): This is a British television show that is based on the American SNL format. It aired on ITV from 2010 to 2011 and featured a mix of sketches, stand-up comedy, and musical performances.
Saturday Night Live (Philippines): This is a Philippine television show that is also based on the American SNL format. It aired on GMA Network from 2003 to 2008 and was known for its comedy sketches and celebrity guests.
Saturday Night Live (Australia): This is an Australian television show that is based on the American SNL format. It aired on the Seven Network from 2012 to 2013 and featured a mix of comedy sketches, celebrity guests, and musical performances.

In general, SNL is a comedy show that is known for its irreverent humor, political satire, and memorable characters.

Off the bat, I think that Llama is going to deliver a funnier sketch. It was to the point, not repetitive, and only included relevant details. DeepSeek on the other hand does not seem to have had enough fine tuning as the answer was very â€œbottyâ€ and not so human-like. Iâ€™m afraid of the weak jokes it will deliver.



Prompt: how would you describe SNLâ€™s humor?
Llama: Saturday Night Live (SNL) is known for its irreverent and often absurdist humor, which can be difficult to pin down or describe. However, here are some key elements that contribute to the showâ€™s humor:

Satire and Parody: SNL frequently uses satire and parody to poke fun at current events, politics, and popular culture. Sketches often exaggerate or distort real-life situations for comedic effect.
Quick-witted Writing: The showâ€™s writers are known for their fast-paced, clever, and often absurd dialogue. Characters and sketches often feature sudden, unexpected twists and turns, keeping the audience on their toes.
Physical Comedy: SNL has a long history of incorporating physical comedy into its sketches, from slapstick to more subtle, nuanced performances.
Pop Culture References: The show frequently references and parodies popular culture, including movies, TV shows, music, and celebrities.
Improvisation: SNL is known for its improvisational elements, with many sketches featuring unscripted moments and ad-libbed lines. This adds an extra layer of unpredictability and humor to the show.
Political Humor: SNL has always been known for its political humor, often tackling controversial topics and figures in its sketches.
Character-Driven Humor: Many of SNLâ€™s sketches revolve around specific characters or archetypes, such as the â€œWeekend Updateâ€ anchors, the â€œConeheads,â€ or the â€œSchweddy Ballsâ€ sketch. These characters often become fan favorites and are revisited throughout the showâ€™s history.
Celebrity Guests: SNL frequently features celebrity guests, who often play themselves or appear in sketches alongside the regular cast members. These appearances can add an extra layer of humor and surprise to the show.

DeepSeek: SNLâ€™s humor is characterized by its irreverent, satirical, and topical nature. The show often uses humor to comment on current events, politics, and popular culture, and it frequently features sketches that parody famous people, movies, TV shows, and other cultural touchstones.
SNLâ€™s humor is often characterized by its use of absurdity, exaggeration, and irony, and it frequently features characters and situations that are over-the-top and exaggerated for comedic effect. The show is also known for its use of improvisation, which allows the cast to be spontaneous and creative in their performances.
Overall, SNLâ€™s humor is often described as irreverent, satirical, and topical, and it appeals to audiences who appreciate intelligent and witty comedy that can both entertain and comment on contemporary issues.

Again, DeepSeek continued to repeat itself (i.e.Â â€œirreverent, satirical, and topicalâ€), while Llama delivered me an organized list of correct details. Now, I wanted to make sure they were going to use the correct cast members, so I verified that they knew the cast of Season 31.

Llama: Season 31 of Saturday Night Live (SNL) premiered on October 3, 2004, and featured a talented cast of actors, comedians, and impressionists. Hereâ€™s a list of the cast members for Season 31 of SNL:

This season also featured several guest hosts and musical guests, including:

Musical guests: 50 Cent, Alicia Keys, Arcade Fire, Ashlee Simpson, Avril Lavigne, BeyoncÃ©, Brandy, Eminem, Gwen Stefani, John Mayer, Kanye West, Mariah Carey, OutKast, R.E.M., Red Hot Chili Peppers, Rihanna, Snoop Dogg, and Usher.

Season 31 of SNL was notable for several reasons, including the addition of new cast members Bill Hader and Andy Samberg, who would go on to become fan favorites and long-time cast members. The season also featured several memorable moments, such as the â€œMore Cowbellâ€ sketch with Will Ferrell and Christopher Walken, and the â€œUnited Wayâ€ sketch with Andy Samberg and Ashton Kutcher.

Once again, Llama pulls through with a more succinct description. Now to confirm with the LLM the specific format of an SNL skit, I asked for the blueprint of a sketch.



Prompt: what is the blueprint for an snl skit?
Llama: The blueprint for an SNL skit typically includes the following elements:

Concept: The first step in creating an SNL skit is to come up with an idea or concept. This can involve brainstorming, researching current events, or identifying a particular theme or topic to tackle. The concept should be concise, relatable, and have the potential to be funny.
Characters: Once the concept is established, the next step is to create characters that can bring the idea to life. Characters should be well-defined, with distinct personalities, motivations, and quirks. They should also be relatable to the audience and have the potential to be funny.
Storyline: A good SNL skit needs a clear storyline that sets up the premise and provides a structure for the comedy to unfold. The storyline should be simple, yet engaging, and should provide opportunities for the characters to interact and play off each other.
Comedic elements: The next step is to identify the comedic elements that will make the skit funny. This can include things like absurdity, irony, satire, parody, stereotypes, and wordplay. The comedic elements should be integrated into the storyline and character interactions to create a seamless and hilarious experience.
Dialogue: The dialogue in an SNL skit should be natural, witty, and funny. It should be tailored to each characterâ€™s personality and should advance the storyline. The dialogue should also be delivered with good timing and pacing to maximize the comedic impact.
Visual elements: SNL skits often incorporate visual elements, such as props, costumes, and sets, to enhance the comedy. The visual elements should be clever, creative, and add to the overall humor of the skit.
Pacing: The pacing of an SNL skit is crucial to its success. The skit should have a good rhythm, with moments of tension, release, and surprise. The pacing should also be tailored to the audienceâ€™s attention span and should keep them engaged throughout the skit.
Rehearsal: Before the skit is performed live, the cast and crew will typically rehearse it several times to fine-tune the performance. Rehearsals help identify areas that need improvement, such as timing, pacing, and delivery.
Performance: The final step is to perform the skit in front of a live audience. The cast and crew will work together to bring the skit to life, using their skills and experience to create a hilarious and entertaining experience for the audience. By following these steps, SNL writers and performers can create a blueprint for a successful skit that will leave audiences laughing and entertained.

DeepSeek: The blueprint for an SNL sketch typically includes the following elements:

Concept: The sketch begins with a central concept or idea, which serves as the basis for the humor and action in the sketch.
Characters: The sketch typically features a set of characters, each with their own unique personality and traits.
Setup: The sketch is set up with a brief introduction or premise, which establishes the situation and characters.
Action: The sketch then follows a series of actions or events, which build upon the setup and lead to the punchline or climax.
Punchline: The sketch concludes with a punchline or unexpected twist, which provides the comedic payoff and leaves the audience laughing.
Timing: The sketch is carefully timed and edited to maximize the comedic effect and keep the audience engaged.
Music and Sound Effects: Music and sound effects are often used to enhance the humor and set the tone of the sketch.
Guest Stars: SNL often features guest stars, who add a fresh perspective and energy to the sketch.

Overall, the blueprint for an SNL sketch is a carefully crafted combination of concept, characters, setup, action, punchline, timing, music and sound effects, and guest stars.

Interestingly, the first sentence and the first two bullet points of the texts were virtually the same. I actually think DeepSeekâ€™s response is better in this contextâ€“ short and sweet. I worry about the LLM juggling so many factors in Llamaâ€™s response. At last, I have prepped my LLMs enough! Itâ€™s time for the
Weekend Update on SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE!!!



Prompt: Make a weekend update snl skit script with a Stefon act played by Bill Hader. Follow the same format and joke style as the show normally does, but make it creative and new (do not repeat any old jokes from the show).
Llama: Sure, hereâ€™s a script for a Weekend Update segment featuring Stefon, played by Bill Hader:
[Weekend Update theme music plays]
Announcer: Welcome back to Weekend Update, the only news program thatâ€™s not afraid to tackle the tough issues. And now, hereâ€™s our city correspondent, Stefon, played by Bill Hader.
[Stefon enters, wearing a flamboyant outfit and a confident smile]
Stefon: Thank you, thank you! Itâ€™s great to be back, folks! Iâ€™ve got some fantastic news for you. Did you hear about the new club that just opened up in the city? Itâ€™s called â€œClub Bangerzâ€ and let me tell you, itâ€™s the place to be! Theyâ€™ve got a DJ spinning nothing but the hottest tracks, and the dance floor is packed with people showing off their best moves.
[Stefon takes a sip from an imaginary coffee cup]
Stefon: But thatâ€™s not all, folks! Iâ€™ve also got some juicy gossip for you. I heard that the mayorâ€™s son was spotted at Club Bangerz, getting a little too cozy with one of the strippers. Scandal!
[Stefon leans in, a conspiratorial look on his face]
Stefon: And if thatâ€™s not enough, Iâ€™ve got some breaking news for you. I just got word that a group of chickens have taken over the cityâ€™s main power grid. Thatâ€™s right, folks, the chickens are in charge now!
[Stefon stands up, looking serious for a moment]
Stefon: But donâ€™t worry, the cityâ€™s officials are on it. Theyâ€™re working around the clock to negotiate with the chickens and get the power back on. I mean, who knows what kind of demands theyâ€™re going to make? Maybe they want more corn? Or a better healthcare plan?
[Stefon sits back down, smiling]
Stefon: And finally, Iâ€™ve got some exciting news for all you foodies out there. Thereâ€™s a new restaurant in town thatâ€™s serving up the most delicious dishes youâ€™ve ever tasted. Itâ€™s called â€œBistro Bizarreâ€ and let me tell you, itâ€™s a real treat. Theyâ€™ve got dishes like â€œFlaming Fajitasâ€ and â€œChicken Tikka Tacosâ€ andâ€¦ wait for itâ€¦ â€œCheetos Crusted Cheesecakeâ€!
[Stefon leans in, a mischievous look on his face]
Stefon: But thatâ€™s not all, folks! I heard that if you order the â€œBizarre Bento Boxâ€ and say the secret password, youâ€™ll get a special surprise. Iâ€™m not sure what it is, but I heard itâ€™s something like a â€œFlaming Ferris Wheel Fajita Frenzyâ€!
[Stefon stands up, holding up an imaginary Bento Box]
Stefon: So there you have it, folks, another week in the city. Stay weird, stay wild, and remember, always order the Bizarre Bento Box.
[Weekend Update theme music plays as Stefon exits]
Announcer: Thatâ€™s Stefon, played by Bill Hader. Tune in next week for more news from the city.

Pros of Llama: â€œhereâ€™s our city correspondent, Stefon,â€
Cons of Llama: â€œplayed by Bill Haderâ€, [Stefon takes a sip from an imaginary coffee cup] (out of character), everything past that script commandâ€¦ just so out of character

DeepSeek: Sure, hereâ€™s a Weekend Update SNL skit script featuring Stefon played by Bill Hader:
Anchor: â€œWelcome back to Weekend Update, Iâ€™m [insert anchorâ€™s name]. Joining us now is our nightlife correspondent, Stefon.â€
Stefon: â€œHey, whatâ€™s up guys? Itâ€™s Stefon, and Iâ€™ve got the hottest club in town for you tonight. Itâ€™s called â€˜The Catacomb of Eternal Darknessâ€™.â€
Anchor: â€œThe Catacomb of Eternal Darkness? That soundsâ€¦intense.â€
Stefon: â€œOh, it is. Itâ€™s in the basement of an old haunted house, and you have to crawl through a narrow tunnel to get in. But once youâ€™re inside, itâ€™s like a whole new world. The walls are dripping with slime, and there are creatures lurking in the shadows.â€
Anchor: â€œCreatures?â€
Stefon: â€œYeah, like giant spiders and snakes andâ€¦oh my god, is that a velociraptor?â€
Anchor: â€œA velociraptor?!â€
Stefon: â€œYeah, and get this: the DJ is a giant tarantula. He spins records with his eight legs, and he only plays the darkest, most evil music youâ€™ve ever heard.â€
Anchor: â€œI donâ€™t know if Iâ€™m ready for that, Stefon.â€
Stefon: â€œOh, come on, itâ€™s the coolest club in town. And the best part is, the bouncers are all zombies. Theyâ€™ll let you in for free if you give them a bite of your ear.â€
Anchor: â€œIâ€™m not sure I want to give a zombie a bite of my ear, Stefon.â€
Stefon: â€œTrust me, itâ€™s worth it. And the drinks are to die for - literally. Theyâ€™re made with blood and eye of newt and all sorts of stuff. Youâ€™ll love it.â€
Anchor: â€œI donâ€™t know, Stefon. It sounds a littleâ€¦dangerous.â€
Stefon: â€œOh, it is. But thatâ€™s what makes it so amazing. Trust me, youâ€™ll never forget the night you spent at â€˜The Catacomb of Eternal Darknessâ€™.â€
Anchor: â€œIâ€™ll think about it, Stefon. Thanks for the tip.â€
Stefon: â€œNo problem. See you at the club!â€
Anchor: â€œI donâ€™t think so, Stefon. Thanks for joining us, and weâ€™ll be right back.â€

Pros of DeepSeek: â€œthe hottest club in townâ€
Cons of DeepSeek: not very funny, but much closer the SNL sketches on YouTube



Reflections
Both of these sketches suck!!! I was wrong though and DeepSeek actually presented a more accurate Stefon sketch. Either way, letâ€™s leave it to humans to write the comedy, not some large language models. Iâ€™ll stick to throwback videos on YouTube for now!
Thanks for tuning in!
Emmy

title: Valentineâ€™s Day Advice
text:
Happy Valentineâ€™s Day Readers!

As my boyfriend delivered me flowers this morning, I thought back to high school and laughed about how that never would have happened. So, in trying to come up with a Valentine-centered prompt for an LLM, I decided to create a story about a high school senior who has a crush on a boy and wants to be his Valentine. However, her best friend knows that the crush likes someone else. Iâ€™m interested in seeing how the LLM gives advice as a girl best friend and as a guy best friend.
In my experience, guys are much more direct and will not flatter you as much. Conversely, girls will hype you up and add loving fluff to distract you from reality. Iâ€™ll be looking at the tone, filler words, and overall advice when comparing the two responses. Letâ€™s get started!
Girl Prompt:
I want you to act like my girl bff. We have been best friends all of high school and itâ€™s senior year. Iâ€™m hoping my crush will get me flowers and ask me out. You know that he has a crush on someone else. How do you break this news to me? Be descriptive. Make a game plan for me on how I should go about my day.
Response:
Hey girl! Oh my gosh, senior year is flying by, right? I canâ€™t believe itâ€™s already Valentineâ€™s Day! Iâ€™ve got to say, Iâ€™m so excited for you. I know youâ€™ve been hoping for something special to happen today, especially with your crush.
Iâ€™ve been thinking a lot about it, and I know this might not be what you want to hear, but Iâ€™ve noticed something. Iâ€™ve seen how your crush has been acting lately, and it seems like heâ€™s really into someone else. I know, itâ€™s tough to hear, but I just want to be real with you because youâ€™re my bestie.
Now, before you start feeling down, I want you to remember how amazing you are. Seriously, youâ€™re smart, funny, and absolutely stunning. Thereâ€™s no doubt in my mind that someone out there is going to see all of that and more in you.
Okay, game plan time! Today is still your day, babe. Letâ€™s make it one to remember, regardless of what happens with your crush. First things first, letâ€™s focus on you. Wear something that makes you feel confident and fabulous. We want you to shine bright like the star you are.
Next up, letâ€™s plan some fun activities! How about we grab some lunch together with our other friends? Nothing beats good food and good company, right? Then, letâ€™s do something that makes you feel amazing. Whether itâ€™s watching your favorite movie, pampering yourself with a DIY spa day, or going for a walk in the park, letâ€™s do something that brings you joy.
And hey, who knows? Maybe your crush surprises us all and does something sweet. But if not, just know that itâ€™s his loss, not yours. You have so much to offer, and the right person will see that.
So, are you ready to make this Valentineâ€™s Day one for the books? Letâ€™s do this, girl! ğŸ’–






After reading this response, I immediately felt cared for. Honestly, this LLM did a great job of softly breaking the news to me while still picking me up. I bolded some of the words I donâ€™t expect to see in the boy version. Also, Iâ€™m creating a new conversation for the next prompt with ChatGPT so it does not remember the previous question.



Boy Prompt:
I want you to act like my guy bff. We have been best friends all of high school and itâ€™s senior year. Iâ€™m hoping my crush will get me flowers and ask me out. You know that he has a crush on someone else. How do you break this news to me? Be descriptive. Make a game plan for me on how I should go about my day.

Interesting to note: this prompt made the LLM think he was giving advice man to man instead of man to woman, so I added â€œ(Iâ€™m a girl)â€ right after the first sentence to make it more similar to the first prompt.

Response:
Hey buddy, senior year, can you believe it? Time really does fly. So, listen, Iâ€™ve been thinking about our situation with your crush, and I think itâ€™s time we had a heart-to-heart.
I know youâ€™ve been hoping for that magical moment where your crush sweeps you off your feet with flowers and asks you out. And trust me, Iâ€™ve seen the sparkle in your eyes every time you talk about it. But hereâ€™s the thing: Iâ€™ve noticed some signs that your crush might be interested in someone else.
Iâ€™ve seen the way they look at that other person, the way they light up when theyâ€™re around them. Itâ€™s hard to miss, and itâ€™s been weighing on my mind because I want you to be happy, you know?
So, hereâ€™s what I think we should do:

Prepare Yourself Mentally: I know this news might be tough to hear, but I believe in your strength. Take a moment to let it sink in, but remember, youâ€™re so much more than any crush or romantic gesture.
Keep Your Options Open: While itâ€™s natural to hope for something special with your crush, donâ€™t limit yourself to just one possibility. There are so many amazing people out there, and you deserve someone who sees your worth.
Embrace the Day: Senior year is all about making memories and embracing new experiences. Donâ€™t let this crush situation overshadow your final year in high school. Seize the day, have fun, and make the most of every moment.
Lean on Friends: Youâ€™ve got a solid support system right here. Letâ€™s spend some quality time together, laugh, share stories, and just be there for each other. Remember, weâ€™ve got your back no matter what.

Alright, buddy, what do you say we tackle this day together, with all the courage and resilience weâ€™ve got? No matter what happens, Iâ€™m here for you every step of the way. Letâ€™s make senior year one to remember, okay?

Iâ€™m excited that both my predictions seemed to line up with ChatGPTâ€™s responses. The boyâ€™s POV when giving the advice is much more to the point. I think itâ€™s interesting that the difference is even as much as the guy making a list versus the girl talking her through it. The guyâ€™s â€œfiller wordsâ€ are more stereotypically male, like using â€œbuddyâ€ instead of â€œgirl.â€ As for the tone, he seems sympathetic and takes it to heart whereas the girl felt almost as if she was sweeping it under the rug and wanting her to move on as quickly as possible. Both are interesting ways to deliver bad news, and it feels very human.
So next time you need love advice, maybe ask your favorite LLM!
Thanks for tuning in!
Emmy
